definition: facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
old variant of 禍|祸[huo4]
disaster/misfortune/calamity
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I have been exposed to the presentiment of catastrophe for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 几星期来我一直有大祸临头的感觉。

sentences.english: For me, the july twentieth affair was in every way a calamity .
sentences.chinese: 就我来说，七月二十日事件完全是大祸临头。

sentences.english: During the past the week, I almost always feeling having disaster strikes.
sentences.chinese: 几星期来我一直有大祸临头的感觉。

sentences.english: A rise in interest rates would be disastrous for millions.
sentences.chinese: 利率的增长对数百万人来说是大祸临头。

sentences.english: Damn boys don't think about the wrath that's about to set down on them.
sentences.chinese: 混小子，也不想想，他们就快要大祸临头了。

sentences.english: Oh, calamity , is there no way out?
sentences.chinese: 噢大祸临头了这下可有生路？

sentences.english: "This is a catastrophe for Iran's cinema, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “这对伊朗的电影业来说是大祸临头，”他说。

sentences.english: For weeks, I have had a feeling of impending disaster.
sentences.chinese: 几星期来我一直有大祸临头的感觉。

sentences.english: "This is a catastrophe for Iran's cinema," he said.
sentences.chinese: “这对伊朗的电影业来说是大祸临头，”他说。

definition: to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to befall/to be imminent
anxious/panicky
out of one's wits (idiom)/distracted/stunned
disaster/calamity
lit. body and soul separated (idiom); fig. scared out of one's wits/beside oneself
lit. settling accounts after the autumn harvest (idiom); to wait until the time is ripe to settle accounts/to bide time for revenge
lit. if the rabbit dies, the fox grieves (idiom); fig. to have sympathy with a like-minded person in distress
to run into misfortune
dangerous situation/venerable old age
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
disaster/doom
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to be at death's door (idiom)
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
